page.title: 05 A local character
page.content: The information on this page is taken from an interview with Mr.Tom Fazakerly. Mr. Fazakerly visited school on the 9th July 1985 and brought with him old newspapers,a Register of Electors dated 1945, and a model of the old Banks Chapel. He worked for the Crossens River Drainage Board for 25 years. One of his many duties was as the official mole catcher. As well as catching moles, he caught hares, rabbits, stoats, weasels, and rats. The snares were checked twice a day. He did not like catching hares because they cried like a baby. Rabbits that were caught were eaten. The rats were skinned and their pelts were made into fur coats.
